abstract: This paper develops an algorithm to solve certain quadratic set-covering problems where the constraint set is of the inequality type. It extends one of M. Bellmore and H. D. Ratliff for linear set-covering problems with involutory bases where cutting planes that exclude both integer and noninteger solutions are generated at each iteration. The new algorithm can be used to solve problems of the equality and mixed types by introducing a penalty term in the objective function. Computational experience with the new algorithm is presented.
